source_sentence: 佛說護淨經
translation: Foshuo guanjing jing jing

source_sentence: 失譯人今附東晉錄
translation: The lost translator is now appended to the Eastern Jin Record

source_sentence: 往昔，佛共阿難行，遇值一池，東西四十里，南北四十里，深四十里。
translation: Formerly when the Buddha was traveling with Ānanda, he came upon a lake forty li from east to west and forty li from south to north and forty li deep.

source_sentence: 池中有虫，其形似科蚪，形黑如墨。
translation: In the pond there was an insect shaped like a lotus bud, as dark as black as ink.

source_sentence: 佛語阿難：「識此池中虫不？」
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda, Do you know the worms in this pond?

source_sentence: 答言：「不識。」
translation: He replied, I don't know.

source_sentence: 佛語阿難：「此池中虫者，十方世界大眾僧，食不淨食，墮此臭穢糞屎池中，
translation: The Buddha said to Ānanda, “The worms in this pond feed on impure food and fall into this foul-smelling lake of excrement.

source_sentence: 常食不淨，五百萬世中受此苦惱竟；
translation: They always ate impure food, enduring this pain and suffering for five million world ages.

source_sentence: 後五百世中復墮餓狗中，常食不淨；
translation: In the next five hundred generations they will again fall into the realm of hungry dogs, always eating unclean food.

source_sentence: 復墮猪中，五百世常食不淨；
translation: Again, he fell among the pigs and for five hundred generations always ate impure food.

source_sentence: 復墮蜣蜋中常食不淨。
translation: Again, they'll fall into the midst of a dispute and always eat impure food.

source_sentence: 亦五百世得出為人，常生貧窮家，衣不覆形，食不充口，常食糠飯，恒飢不足。」
translation: Also, in the five hundredth generation, he emerged as a man who was always born in a poor family, whose clothes didn't cover his body, food didn't fill his mouth, and he always ate rice gruel and never had enough to eat.

source_sentence: 佛語諸比丘：「有如是者，受罪尤苦，無量無邊。
translation: The Buddha said to the monks, If there's such a person, they'll experience especially painful crimes that are immeasurable and limitless.

source_sentence: 誡語後世末法中諸比丘不可不慎，一切眾僧有住止處，作不淨食，不足往食。
translation: He admonished the monks of later ages not to be cautious, and all the saṃgha had dwelling places where they made impure food that wasn't enough to eat.

source_sentence: 欲淨食者，一切白。
translation: Those who want to eat purely will all be white.

source_sentence: 衣食如法，著衣持鉢，稱四威儀，如法往造乞，是真比丘，除其邪命，
translation: He dresses and feeds in accordance with the Dharma, puts on his robes, takes his almsbowl, praises the four proper manners, and goes begging in accordance with the Dharma. This is a true monk who has rid himself of wrong live

source_sentence: 如法活命。
translation: He'll live according to the teaching.

source_sentence: 「佛不妄言，福報如影響。
translation: The Buddha doesn't speak falsely, and the rewards of merit are like an influence.

source_sentence: 往昔比丘，新得阿羅漢有結業身，有便利患，夜闇上廁。
translation: In the past, a monk who had newly attained arhatship had a fettered karmic body, and with conveniences and troubles, he went up to the toilet at night in the darkness.

source_sentence: 見一比丘在廁邊呻吟，阿羅漢語是比丘：『汝本好用意人，云何墮餓鬼中呻吟如是？』
translation: When he saw a monk moaning at the side of the toilet, the arhat said to that monk, 'You're originally good-natured, so how could you have fallen into hungry ghosts and moaning like this?'

source_sentence: 餓鬼比丘答言：『我餓渴來久，五百餘年不見漿水，正欲趣廁用食不淨，
translation: The hungry ghost monk replied, 'I've been hungry and thirsty for a long time. For more than five hundred years I haven't seen any juice or water, just wanting to go to the toilet and eating impure food.

source_sentence: 護廁鬼神鐵杖打我，不得近廁。
translation: The guardians of the latrine demons beat me with an iron stick and won't allow me to approach the latrine.

source_sentence: 憶念本曾作比丘，知僧事時，是用觸眾僧淨食，以不淨食食眾僧，故致此殃。』
translation: I remember that when I was once a monk who knew the saṃgha's business, this was because he touched the saṃgha with pure food and fed it to the saṃgha with impure food, which caused this misfortune.'

source_sentence: 遇值阿羅漢善知識，阿羅漢為比丘僧中燒香呪願，即免餓鬼，還復人道。」
translation: When he meets an arhat who's a good friend, the arhat burns incense and wishes to be burned among the monks and nuns, so he'll be freed from hungry ghosts and return to the human path.

source_sentence: 佛語諸比丘：「不可不慎，一切不得觸眾僧淨食。
translation: The Buddha said to the monks, Don't be careless; you mustn't touch the pure food of the saṃgha with anything.

source_sentence: 佛不虛言，福報如影響。
translation: The Buddha doesn't speak falsely, and the rewards of merit are like an influence.

source_sentence: 十八地獄經中出罪福，此餓鬼本從人道中來，以不清淨手，觸眾僧淨器；
translation: These hungry ghosts originally came from the human realm and touched the Sangha’s pure receptacle by means of an impure hand.

source_sentence: 以不淨手，觸沙門淨食。
translation: With an impure hand, he touches the ascetic with pure food.

source_sentence: 以不淨食，著沙門淨食中。
translation: They take impure food and put it in the pure food of the ascetics.

source_sentence: 以不淨食，食眾僧故，後五百世中，墮餓鬼中，常食不淨。
translation: Because they eat impure food, they feed the saṃgha. In the next five hundred generations they will fall into the realm of hungry ghosts and always eat impure food.

source_sentence: 欲趣廁上食糞，于時廁神手捉鐵杖打之，令不得近。
translation: When he wanted to go up to the toilet to eat dung, the toilet god then grabbed an iron stick with his hand and beat him so he couldn't get near it.

source_sentence: 此鬼食人膿血、涕唾及蕩滌惡汁，常伺捕婦女產血不淨，以為飲食。
translation: These ghosts feed on human pus, blood, tears, spittle, and impure juice. They constantly seek to catch women who give unclean blood as food and drink.

source_sentence: 復經五百世，墮猪狗蜣蜋之中，常食臭糞不淨。
translation: For another five hundred generations, he fell into the dung of pigs and dogs and always ate foul-smelling dung that was impure.

source_sentence: 受斯苦劇，累世如此，於百千劫，無有出期，難得解脫，痛不可言。
translation: For hundreds of thousands of eons I have suffered this kind of pain and distress. There is no time for me to leave this world. It is difficult to be liberated; the pain cannot be described in words.

source_sentence: 「以不淨手觸男根，或觸女根，觸沙門淨器，觸沙門淨食。
translation: “With an impure hand, he touches the male faculty or the female faculty, touches the ascetic’s clean container, and touches the ascetic’s pure food.

source_sentence: 以不淨食，著沙門淨食中；
translation: They take unclean food and put it in the pure food of renunciants.

source_sentence: 以不淨食，食眾僧故，致此殃。
translation: This calamity is caused by eating impure food, which feeds the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 一切人肉眼不知罪福。
translation: All people's physical eyes don't know sin or merit.

source_sentence: 自今以後，欲得福祐，佐眾僧作食，以清淨手，捉眾僧淨器，淨手淘米，
translation: From now on, wishing to attain blessedness, he joined the sangha in cooking food for the assembly. He grasped the Sangha’s almsbowl with his clean hands and dipped rice into it with his clean hands.

source_sentence: 及以淨米，著眾僧淨食中者，得福無量。
translation: And those who put pure rice in the pure food of the saṃgha will attain measureless merit.

source_sentence: 自今以後，以此為常，一切眾人普使聞知：一切檀越，施設法會，供齋調度，
translation: From now on, these things are constant. All the people of the assembly let them all hear and know that all the donors have set up religious assemblies, offered sacrifices, and disciplined themselves.

source_sentence: 持齋者得食，不持齋者不得食。
translation: Those who observe the fast will be allowed to eat, but those who don't observe it won't be allowed to eat.

source_sentence: 此飯一日持齋，得六十萬世餘糧。
translation: In the course of one day’s fasting he obtained the remaining provisions for sixty thousand world ages.

source_sentence: 不持齋者，六十萬世墮餓鬼中。
translation: Those who don't observe purification will fall into the hungry ghosts for 60,000 lifetimes.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 此信施難銷故。
translation: It's because this faith and generosity are difficult to dispel.

source_sentence: 寧吞熱鐵丸，不食此飯。
translation: I'd rather swallow a hot iron ball than eat this rice.

source_sentence: 吞熱鐵丸，須臾間耳，食此信施，久受大苦，五百萬世中受餓鬼苦。
translation: They swallow hot iron balls in their ears for a moment, and when they eat this faithful offering, they'll experience great suffering for a long time, which will cause the suffering of hungry ghosts in five million worlds.

source_sentence: 「諸有設食之處，一切如法作齋，不得懷挾餘殘食，歸給妻子。
translation: Anyone who sets up a place to eat should observe the precepts in accordance with the Dharma. They should not store food left over and return it to their wife or children.

source_sentence: 若食此飯，若腋底挾擔，後五百世，常挾熱鐵輪，左腋底入從右腋底出。
translation: If he eats this rice, or if he carries it in his armpits, he'll always carry a hot iron wheel for the next five hundred generations, entering under his left armpit and exiting under his right armpit.

source_sentence: 一切齋飯，不可不慎，一米化作熱丸。
translation: All the food for fasting should be eaten with caution, and one grain of rice is transformed into a hot ball.

source_sentence: 「一切賢者施設福會，於先嘗啜此食，都作殘食，唐作此會，不如不作。
translation: All the venerable monks established a meritorious assembly, and when they had previously tasted this food, they all prepared leftover food. It's better to make this assembly in China than not making it.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 諸天不歡，鬼神不喜。
translation: The gods won't rejoice, and ghosts and spirits won't rejoice.

source_sentence: 此人於先甞者，亦五百世中受餓鬼苦。
translation: This person who was previously hungry also suffered the suffering of hungry ghosts for five hundred world ages.

source_sentence: 自今已後，欲得福者，如法作齋食，可得福德，諸天歡喜，百神慶悅，
translation: “From now on, those who wish to attain good fortune should observe the proper rules of purification and eat in accordance with the Dharma. This will enable them to attain good fortune.” The gods were delighted and a hundred goddesses rejo

source_sentence: 天神擁護。
translation: Gods and goddesses embraced him.

source_sentence: 經不虛言，福報如影響。」
translation: The sūtras don't speak falsely, and the rewards of merit are like influences.

source_sentence: 佛說護淨經
translation: Foshuo guanjing jing jing
